com.camerontec.catalys.core.crypto

Interface IEncryptionEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CryptixCrypto, EncryptionEngineBase, NullCrypto

    public interface IEncryptionEngine
    All encryption packages must be wrapped up in this interface in order to be used by Catalys.

    In addition objects that implement this interface must also have a null constructor.

      • logonMessageDecryption

        byte[] logonMessageDecryption(byte[] data)
                       throws CryptoException
        Not intended for use by application code.

        Decrypts the given secure logon message data, returning the decrypted data.

        Used internally by the Message class when decrypting logon messages.

        Note:
        Logon messages are decrypted differently to other FIX messages.
        See the FIX Security application note on the FIX web site.

        Parameters:
        data - TBD
        Returns:
        TBD
        Throws:
        CryptoException - if the DES master key has not been defined or if there is a problem with the security package.

      • logonMessageEncryption

        byte[] logonMessageEncryption(byte[] data)
                       throws CryptoException
        Not intended for use by application code.

        Encrypts the given secure logon message data, returning the encrypted data.

        Used internally by the Message class when encrypting logon messages.

        Note:
        Logon messages are encrypted differently to other FIX messages.
        See the FIX Security application note on the FIX web site.

        Parameters:
        data - TBD
        Returns:
        TBD
        Throws:
        CryptoException - if the DES master key has not been defined or if there is a problem with the security package.

      • setDesMasterKey

        void setDesMasterKey(String hexString)
              throws CryptoException
        Creates DES master key from hexadecimal string.

        If you expect to be using pure DES (Encrypt method 2) you must have set a master DES key that both you and the sender are aware of.

        If you will not be using pure DES, you do not need to set this.

        This DES master key is used to encrypt the randomly generated session DES key which both parties will use for encoding messages in this session.

        Parameters:
        hexString - an hexadecimal string
        Throws:
        CryptoException - if there is a problem with the security package

      • setMyPrivateKey

        void setMyPrivateKey(Key newMyPrivateKey)
        If you will be using any methods involving private/encryption, you need to tell Crypto your private key and the other's key.

        You will encrypt the DES key that you propose with his key, so that only he can decrypt it.

        You will use your private key to sign the message, so that he, using your key to check the signature will be sure that the message came from you.

        Parameters:
        newMyPrivateKey - private key

      • setMyPrivateKey

        void setMyPrivateKey(String keyName,
                     String passPhrase)
        Set my private key, just using the name, this is used for encryption using key rings.
        Parameters:
        keyName - key name
        passPhrase - pass phrase

      • getEncryptMethod

        int getEncryptMethod()
        Returns:
        encrypt method. See FIX specification, tag 98, for valid encrypt method values.

      • setEncryptMethod

        void setEncryptMethod(int newEncryptMethod)
               throws CryptoException
        Set encrypt method.
        Parameters:
        newEncryptMethod - encrypt method
        Throws:
        CryptoException - if there is a problem with the security package

      • isAutoInitializeCipher

        boolean isAutoInitializeCipher()
        If true the encryption cipher should be reinitialized with each call to encrypt or decrypt bytes.

        Defaults to true.

        Returns:
        True if the ciphers are initialized on each call.

      • setAutoInitializeCipher

        void setAutoInitializeCipher(boolean autoInitializeCipher)
        If true the encryption cipher should be reinitialized with each call to encrypt or decrypt bytes.

        Defaults to true.

        Parameters:
        autoInitializeCipher - True if the ciphers are initialized on each call.

      • isEncryptionEnabled

        boolean isEncryptionEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if encryption is currently enabled. Will return true if the encryption method has been set to a valid supported value other than Constants.ENC_None.

      • isEncryptionInstalled

        boolean isEncryptionInstalled()
        Returns:
        true if encryption package is installed.

      • getMessageDigest

        MessageDigest getMessageDigest()
        Not intended for use by application code. Note: The message digest is actually computed in the Message object.
        Returns:
        the current message digest object.
